title: QuakerBull
author: QuakerBull
content: Hi folks, I'm curious to know what the general preference is regarding Auctions lengths, Short Auctions: 48 hours - Creates greater interest and engagement in the forum- Greater turnover of products and innovation- excitement - Higher vigilance of buyersLong Auctions: Up to 5 Days - Greater and more prolonged exposure to the post- An opportunity for many forum members to be exposed for sale, active/inactiveI would be happy if you share your opinion on the subject   QB

comments.author: JanEmil
comments.body: Short. I never bid the long ones. BTC could 10x waiting

comments.author: QuakerBull
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on November 17, 2022, 07:00:03 PMShort. I never bid the long ones. BTC could 10x waiting Or the opposite in your favor

comments.author: slimzak
comments.body: Quote from: QuakerBull on November 17, 2022, 07:04:38 PMQuote from: JanEmil on November 17, 2022, 07:00:03 PMShort. I never bid the long ones. BTC could 10x waiting Or the opposite in your favor If btc 10x he can't retract his bid. The opposite wouldn't be in his favor as others will have time to outbid him if btc goes lower.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: I like 5 days... gives people who do not frequent the forum time to see everything if they only log in every couple days.

comments.author: QuakerBull
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on November 17, 2022, 07:15:03 PMI like 5 days... gives people who do not frequent the forum time to see everything if they only log in every couple days.Logical thinking, but don't you think that if those forum members who log in once in a while lose several auctions, it won't make them more active to avoid missing out?

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: Long auctions.  And anyone who isn't a whale can wait until the last day to bid to avoid big swings in BTC price.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I also believe that the right time for an auction is at least 5 days.it is not said that all interested parties access the forum and notice that specific auction.on average, about 15-25 posts are created/upped per day in this section...if an auction lasts 48 hours and there are no bids, it is practically not seen...Quote from: QuakerBull on November 17, 2022, 07:21:49 PMLogical thinking, but don't you think that if those forum members who log in once in a while lose several auctions, it won't make them more active to avoid missing out?I think that users are unable to be active also due to the various commitments of everyday-life and the need to "prioritize" the various activities like family work etc

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Short is exciting and fun. As a seller I would most of the time use a longer duration, though.There are quite a few real collectors that log on maybe once a week (I myself had phases like this) and having an auction that misses over 50% of folks that could be interested in buying is not beneficial.

comments.author: QuakerBull
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on November 17, 2022, 07:30:51 PMI also believe that the right time for an auction is at least 5 days.it is not said that all interested parties access the forum and notice that specific auction.on average, about 15-25 posts are created/upped per day in this section...if an auction lasts 48 hours and there are no bids, it is practically not seen...Quote from: QuakerBull on November 17, 2022, 07:21:49 PMLogical thinking, but don't you think that if those forum members who log in once in a while lose several auctions, it won't make them more active to avoid missing out?I think that users are unable to be active also due to the various commitments of everyday-life and the need to "prioritize" the various activities like family work etcI can relate to it. It makes a lot of sense, especially when you have kids and a full-time job. 24 hours a day isn't enough, apparently

comments.author: Honeybadger2014
comments.body: as a potential buyer, i love shorter auctions.  I think they are just more exciting, not as long to wait to see results.  it also greatly encourages impulse buys...  (not necessarily good for the buyer, but usually great for seller)If i was a seller, i'd probably select the longer so more people can see it.  but then i would have to bump it and promote it... so maybe not...

comments.author: markinaz
comments.body: I like the longer auctions.... Some days I get rather busy at work and don't check the forum regularly and then after work, the last thing I want to stare at is a computer, so I skip some days.   5 days gives me the best chance of seeing the auction and then I can plan accordingly.

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: Short. With the long auctions (most of the time), all the bidding happens at the very end of auction anyway. Cut out all the dead time waiting on the end result. My other reason is a bit more selfish… I work offshore so when some auctions go long or last days and days I end up missing them bc I get called offshore where I have zero service. That reall sucks when that happens

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: Bullion-n-BTC on November 17, 2022, 08:13:24 PMShort. With the long auctions (most of the time), all the bidding happens at the very end of auction anyway. Cut out all the dead time waiting on the end result. My other reason is a bit more selfish… I work offshore so when some auctions go long or last days and days I end up missing them bc I get called offshore where I have zero service. That reall sucks when that happensI agree that usually except the last day it's kind of "dead" time. However many people will plainly miss an otherwise interesting auction for them, if it's 24h or 48h only.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: I would also vote for longer auctions but not longer than 7 days.It would also depend on the product, some products would benefit from the longertime span but there are others which would only need 3 days!More people on the Collectibles board means more activity, but yea we have nocontrol over that. Technically I recon more people means possibly less auction time needed and vice a versa

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: My personal preference is 3-5 days as a seller. As I buyer , it’s hard to say.I’ve certainly seen a few changes on the forum over the last 2 yrs ish - there’s definitely a tendency for shorter auctions recently. Not sure if this is a good or bad thing . Maybe set up a poll ?Very interesting thread and thanks for bringing it up  Edit - tricky thing too is the end time of auctions. What’s the most convenient time for all the prospective buyers to be available. Maybe there could be a concensus

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Mbitr on November 17, 2022, 10:56:20 PMtricky thing too is the end time of auctions. What’s the most convenient time for all the prospective buyers to be available. Maybe there could be a concensus   The US and EU seem to be where the majority of active bidders/collectors are at this time..... so I have found that mid afternoon /early evening US time is usually the best.This allows many US bidders to be off of work/home and this also allows most EU bidders to not have to stay up too late with a 5 to 8 hour time difference.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: I’m personally a fan of longer auctions. There’s a lot of potential buyers on here who don’t view the forum but maybe once every week or two, and I feel like you’re setting yourself up for a bit less or a return if you’re not running them for a full week. Of course you can run shorter ones that do every bit as well, but I feel like you get a better shot with a full week.

comments.author: cygan

What’s the most convenient time for all the prospective buyers to be available. Maybe there could be a concensus   The US and EU seem to be where the majority of active bidders/collectors are at this time..... so I have found that mid afternoon /early evening US time is usually the best.This allows many US bidders to be off of work/home and this also allows most EU bidders to not have to stay up too late with a 5 to 8 hour time difference.as a seller myself i prefer 5-7 days auctions that end on saturday (just before midnight in eu) ... so the american friends can also bid at the end ... and since most people are at home on saturdays and do not have to work i find this time the best

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 18, 2022, 07:43:25 AMas a seller myself i prefer 5-7 days auctions that end on saturday (just before midnight in eu) ... so the american friends can also bid at the end ... and since most people are at home on saturdays and do not have to work i find this time the best Interesting. I tend to go for an auction that ends on a Sunday for this very reason.
